result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Justino Chaparro-Payan

records.addlTxt: Status conference on December 12, 2022 at 09:00 am.
w/ elements and ccs

[MK; Court Reporter-Mary Heederik] 
case called at 10:07am.
Defendant Justino Chaparro-Payan in court with Attorney Sylvie Dahnert.  ADA Brookellen Teuber in court for the State of Wisconsin.  
Shawna Stevenoski is sworn as Spanish Interpreter. 
Constitutional rights reviewed; pleas of " Guilty " are entered on Counts #2 and #3; factual basis stipulated. The Court accepts the plea, finds the Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #1. 
On request of the Defense, the Court schedules sentencing on a later date.
recess 10:21am

NEXT:  Sentencing on December 12th at 9:00am
Status conference on October 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.

[ml] Case called at 1:35PM
Defendant Justino Chaparro-Payan in court with Attorney Sylvie Dahnert. ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Spanish Interpreter Shawna Stevenoski remains under oath.
Att Dahnert requests that these matters be scheduled for an additional Status Conference, citing Rock County file 19CF250 and the Jury Trial that is scheduled in that file.
Att Dahnert advises that she will update the Court as to any future progress/developments in the Rock County file.

recess 1:40PM

NEXT: Status Conference on 10/21 at 10:00AM (Defendant may appear via Zoom if he is in custody)

Pre-trial conference on July 20, 2022 at 11:40 am.
Status conference on August 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

[MK] case called at 8:34am 
Defendant Justino Chaparro-Payan in court with Attorney Sylvie Dahnert.  ADA Michael Witt appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Mr. Chaparro waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--pleas of "not guilty" are entered
--in response to the Court's inquiry, both counsel indicate they are not requesting speedy trial.
recess 8:40am

NEXT:   (1) Pretrial Conference on July 20th at 11:40am-only counsel need to appear,   (2) Status Conference on August 18th at 1:30pm

Pre-trial conference on June 22, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Status conference on June 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.

[ml] Case called at 10:01AM
[All Appearances via Zoom]
Defendant Justino Chaparro-Payan appears with attorney Sylvie Dahnert. ADA Michael Witt appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Spanish Interpreter Shawna Stevenoski sworn-in.
Att Dahnert advises that they will continue to waive Preliminary Hearing time limits, and requests that a Pretrial be scheduled. The State has no objection, and requests that a Preliminary Hearing be scheduled as well.

recess 10:09AM

NEXT: 
(1) Pretrial Conference on 06/22 at 11:00AM with counsel appearances only
(2) Preliminary Hearing on 06/28 at 8:30AM with in person appearances
Sylvie Dahnert
Routed to JA/FCC for further review. (04/25) ML
Status conference on May 17, 2022 at 10:00 am.

[ma] Case called at 8:38 AM 
Defendant Justino Chaparro-Payan appears in court, in custody.  Krysta Parson appears for the State of Wisconsin. Officer-Witness present
Shawna Stevenoski sworn as Spanish Interpreter

The Court reviews the court record.

Defendant asserts the he did not know he was supposed to complete and return SPD paperwork. 

The Court adjourns to allow Defendant time to complete and return paperwork. 

recess: 8:45am 
NEXT: Status of Counsel on 5/17/22 at 10:00am via zoom
Copy of Letter from SPD to Defendant
certified copy to DA Office (3/3/22--ma)
to Produce
Preliminary hearing on April 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Scheduling Order
Notice of Court Order to Jefferson County Dispatch
--no operation of a motor vehicle

[ae] case called 09:12 AM Defendant Justino Chaparro-Payan appeared by telephone from Rock Co Jail. ADA Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The Defendant verifies that the address and date of birth listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited; Defendant requests an interpreter.

recess 9:19 am
case recalled 9:34 am, Spanish Interpreter Kelly Salas sworn in

The Defendant verifies that the address and date of birth listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited
Right to counsel is given.  
Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint.

The Court requires $500 Signature Bond, with conditions:
--no operation of a motor vehicle


recess 9:46 am
NEXT: (1) Preliminary Hearing on 4/8/22 at 8:30 am [Clerk is to notify SPD that defendant is requesting paperwork to be sent to him]
Initial appearance on February 28, 2022 at 09:00 am.

[ae] case called 10:50 AM Defendant Justino Chaparro-Payan not in court.  ADA Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is currently in custody at Rock County Jail, the court adjourns todays hearing
recess: 10:52 am
NEXT IA 2/28/22 at 9:00 am
NOTE: Copy of complaint mailed to Justino at the Rock Co. Jail on 02/21/2022. (NMS)
